4 // Message to the person tempted to delete this file when integrating ImGui into their code base:
5 // Don't do it! Do NOT remove this file from your project! It is useful reference code that you and other users will want to refer to.
6 // Everything in this file will be stripped out by the linker if you don't call ImGui::ShowDemoWindow().
7 // During development, you can call ImGui::ShowDemoWindow() in your code to learn about various features of ImGui. Have it wired in a debug menu!
8 // Removing this file from your project is hindering access to documentation for everyone in your team, likely leading you to poorer usage of the library.
9 // Note that you can #define IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS in imconfig.h for the same effect.
10 // If you want to link core ImGui in your final builds but not those demo windows, #define IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS in imconfig.h and those functions will be empty.
11 // In other situation, when you have ImGui available you probably want this to be available for reference and execution.
12 // Thank you,
13 // -Your beloved friend, imgui_demo.cpp (that you won't delete)
14 
15 // Message to beginner C/C++ programmers. About the meaning of 'static': in this demo code, we frequently we use 'static' variables inside functions.
16 // We do this as a way to gather code and data in the same place, just to make the demo code faster to read, faster to write, and use less code.
17 // A static variable persist across calls, so it is essentially like a global variable but declared inside the scope of the function.
18 // It also happens to be a convenient way of storing simple UI related information as long as your function doesn't need to be reentrant or used in threads.
19 // This might be a pattern you occasionally want to use in your code, but most of the real data you would be editing is likely to be stored outside your function.

92 static void ShowHelpMarker(const char* desc)
93 {
94  ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
95  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
96  {
97  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
98  ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 35.0f);
99  ImGui::TextUnformatted(desc);
100  ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
101  ImGui::EndTooltip();
102  }
103 }

105 void ImGui::ShowUserGuide()
106 {

110  ImGui::BulletText("TAB/SHIFT+TAB to cycle through keyboard editable fields.");
111  ImGui::BulletText("CTRL+Click on a slider or drag box to input value as text.");
112  if (ImGui::GetIO().FontAllowUserScaling)
113  ImGui::BulletText("CTRL+Mouse Wheel to zoom window contents.");
114  ImGui::BulletText("Mouse Wheel to scroll.");
115  ImGui::BulletText("While editing text:\n");
116  ImGui::Indent();
117  ImGui::BulletText("Hold SHIFT or use mouse to select text.");
118  ImGui::BulletText("CTRL+Left/Right to word jump.");
119  ImGui::BulletText("CTRL+A or double-click to select all.");
120  ImGui::BulletText("CTRL+X,CTRL+C,CTRL+V to use clipboard.");

122  ImGui::BulletText("ESCAPE to revert.");
123  ImGui::BulletText("You can apply arithmetic operators +,*,/ on numerical values.\nUse +- to subtract.");

429  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Advanced, with Selectable nodes"))
430  {
431  ShowHelpMarker("This is a more standard looking tree with selectable nodes.\nClick to select, CTRL+Click to toggle, click on arrows or double-click to open.");
432  static bool align_label_with_current_x_position = false;
433  ImGui::Checkbox("Align label with current X position)", &align_label_with_current_x_position);
434  ImGui::Text("Hello!");
435  if (align_label_with_current_x_position)
436  ImGui::Unindent(ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
437 
438  static int selection_mask = (1 << 2); // Dumb representation of what may be user-side selection state. You may carry selection state inside or outside your objects in whatever format you see fit.
439  int node_clicked = -1; // Temporary storage of what node we have clicked to process selection at the end of the loop. May be a pointer to your own node type, etc.
440  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_IndentSpacing, ImGui::GetFontSize()*3); // Increase spacing to differentiate leaves from expanded contents.
441  for (int i = 0; i < 6; i++)
442  {
443  // Disable the default open on single-click behavior and pass in Selected flag according to our selection state.
444  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags node_flags = ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnArrow | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_OpenOnDoubleClick | ((selection_mask & (1 << i)) ? ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected : 0);
445  if (i < 3)
446  {
447  // Node
448  bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNodeEx((void*)(intptr_t)i, node_flags, "Selectable Node %d", i);
449  if (ImGui::IsItemClicked())
450  node_clicked = i;
451  if (node_open)
452  {
453  ImGui::Text("Blah blah\nBlah Blah");
454  ImGui::TreePop();
455  }
456  }
457  else
458  {
459  // Leaf: The only reason we have a TreeNode at all is to allow selection of the leaf. Otherwise we can use BulletText() or TreeAdvanceToLabelPos()+Text().
460  node_flags |= ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Leaf | ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_NoTreePushOnOpen; // ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Bullet
461  ImGui::TreeNodeEx((void*)(intptr_t)i, node_flags, "Selectable Leaf %d", i);
462  if (ImGui::IsItemClicked())
463  node_clicked = i;
464  }
465  }
466  if (node_clicked != -1)
467  {
468  // Update selection state. Process outside of tree loop to avoid visual inconsistencies during the clicking-frame.
469  if (ImGui::GetIO().KeyCtrl)
470  selection_mask ^= (1 << node_clicked); // CTRL+click to toggle
471  else //if (!(selection_mask & (1 << node_clicked))) // Depending on selection behavior you want, this commented bit preserve selection when clicking on item that is part of the selection
472  selection_mask = (1 << node_clicked); // Click to single-select
473  }
474  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
475  if (align_label_with_current_x_position)
476  ImGui::Indent(ImGui::GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
477  ImGui::TreePop();
478  }
479  ImGui::TreePop();

554  // - From C++11 you can use the u8"my text" syntax to encode literal strings as UTF-8
555  // - For earlier compiler, you may be able to encode your sources as UTF-8 (e.g. Visual Studio save your file as 'UTF-8 without signature')

557  // Instead we are encoding a few strings with hexadecimal constants. Don't do this in your application!
558  // Please use u8"text in any language" in your application!

575 
576  // Here we are grabbing the font texture because that's the only one we have access to inside the demo code.
577  // Remember that ImTextureID is just storage for whatever you want it to be, it is essentially a value that will be passed to the render function inside the ImDrawCmd structure.
578  // If you use one of the default imgui_impl_XXXX.cpp renderer, they all have comments at the top of their file to specify what they expect to be stored in ImTextureID.
579  // (for example, the imgui_impl_dx11.cpp renderer expect a 'ID3D11ShaderResourceView*' pointer. The imgui_impl_glfw_gl3.cpp renderer expect a GLuint OpenGL texture identifier etc.)
580  // If you decided that ImTextureID = MyEngineTexture*, then you can pass your MyEngineTexture* pointers to ImGui::Image(), and gather width/height through your own functions, etc.
581  // Using ShowMetricsWindow() as a "debugger" to inspect the draw data that are being passed to your render will help you debug issues if you are confused about this.
582  // Consider using the lower-level ImDrawList::AddImage() API, via ImGui::GetWindowDrawList()->AddImage().
583  ImTextureID my_tex_id = io.Fonts->TexID;
584  float my_tex_w = (float)io.Fonts->TexWidth;
585  float my_tex_h = (float)io.Fonts->TexHeight;
586

588  ImVec2 pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
589  ImGui::Image(my_tex_id, ImVec2(my_tex_w, my_tex_h), ImVec2(0,0), ImVec2(1,1), ImColor(255,255,255,255), ImColor(255,255,255,128));
590  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())

592  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
593  float region_sz = 32.0f;
594  float region_x = io.MousePos.x - pos.x - region_sz * 0.5f; if (region_x < 0.0f) region_x = 0.0f; else if (region_x > my_tex_w - region_sz) region_x = my_tex_w - region_sz;
595  float region_y = io.MousePos.y - pos.y - region_sz * 0.5f; if (region_y < 0.0f) region_y = 0.0f; else if (region_y > my_tex_h - region_sz) region_y = my_tex_h - region_sz;
596  float zoom = 4.0f;
597  ImGui::Text("Min: (%.2f, %.2f)", region_x, region_y);
598  ImGui::Text("Max: (%.2f, %.2f)", region_x + region_sz, region_y + region_sz);
599  ImVec2 uv0 = ImVec2((region_x) / my_tex_w, (region_y) / my_tex_h);
600  ImVec2 uv1 = ImVec2((region_x + region_sz) / my_tex_w, (region_y + region_sz) / my_tex_h);
601  ImGui::Image(my_tex_id, ImVec2(region_sz * zoom, region_sz * zoom), uv0, uv1, ImColor(255,255,255,255), ImColor(255,255,255,128));

803  // Create a dummy array of contiguous float values to plot
804  // Tip: If your float aren't contiguous but part of a structure, you can pass a pointer to your first float and the sizeof() of your structure in the Stride parameter.

813  values[values_offset] = cosf(phase);
814  values_offset = (values_offset+1) % IM_ARRAYSIZE(values);
815  phase += 0.10f*values_offset;
816  refresh_time += 1.0f/60.0f;
817  }

821  // Use functions to generate output
822  // FIXME: This is rather awkward because current plot API only pass in indices. We probably want an API passing floats and user provide sample rate/count.
823  struct Funcs
824  {
825  static float Sin(void*, int i) { return sinf(i * 0.1f); }
826  static float Saw(void*, int i) { return (i & 1) ? 1.0f : -1.0f; }
827  };

833  float (*func)(void*, int) = (func_type == 0) ? Funcs::Sin : Funcs::Saw;

844  if (progress <= -0.1f) { progress = -0.1f; progress_dir *= -1.0f; }

1005  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Data Types"))
1006  {
1007  // The DragScalar, InputScalar, SliderScalar functions allow manipulating most common data types: signed/unsigned int/long long and float/double
1008  // To avoid polluting the public API with all possible combinations, we use the ImGuiDataType enum to pass the type, and argument-by-values are turned into argument-by-address.
1009  // This is the reason the test code below creates local variables to hold "zero" "one" etc. for each types.
1010  // In practice, if you frequently use a given type that is not covered by the normal API entry points, you may want to wrap it yourself inside a 1 line function
1011  // which can take typed values argument instead of void*, and then pass their address to the generic function. For example:
1012  // bool SliderU64(const char *label, u64* value, u64 min = 0, u64 max = 0, const char* format = "%lld") { return SliderScalar(label, ImGuiDataType_U64, value, &min, &max, format); }
1013  // Below are helper variables we can take the address of to work-around this:
1014  // Note that the SliderScalar function has a maximum usable range of half the natural type maximum, hence the /2 below.
1015  const ImS32 s32_zero = 0, s32_one = 1, s32_fifty = 50, s32_min = INT_MIN/2, s32_max = INT_MAX/2, s32_hi_a = INT_MAX/2 - 100, s32_hi_b = INT_MAX/2;
1016  const ImU32 u32_zero = 0, u32_one = 1, u32_fifty = 50, u32_min = 0, u32_max = UINT_MAX/2, u32_hi_a = UINT_MAX/2 - 100, u32_hi_b = UINT_MAX/2;
1017  const ImS64 s64_zero = 0, s64_one = 1, s64_fifty = 50, s64_min = LLONG_MIN/2, s64_max = LLONG_MAX/2, s64_hi_a = LLONG_MAX/2 - 100, s64_hi_b = LLONG_MAX/2;
1018  const ImU64 u64_zero = 0, u64_one = 1, u64_fifty = 50, u64_min = 0, u64_max = ULLONG_MAX/2, u64_hi_a = ULLONG_MAX/2 - 100, u64_hi_b = ULLONG_MAX/2;
1019  const float f32_zero = 0.f, f32_one = 1.f, f32_lo_a = -10000000000.0f, f32_hi_a = +10000000000.0f;
1020  const double f64_zero = 0., f64_one = 1., f64_lo_a = -1000000000000000, f64_hi_a = +1000000000000000;

2138 // Demo helper function to select among default colors. See ShowStyleEditor() for more advanced options.
2139 // Here we use the simplified Combo() api that packs items into a single literal string. Useful for quick combo boxes where the choices are known locally.
2140 bool ImGui::ShowStyleSelector(const char* label)
2141 {
2142  static int style_idx = -1;
2143  if (ImGui::Combo(label, &style_idx, "Classic\0Dark\0Light\0"))
2144  {
2145  switch (style_idx)
2146  {
2147  case 0: ImGui::StyleColorsClassic(); break;
2148  case 1: ImGui::StyleColorsDark(); break;
2149  case 2: ImGui::StyleColorsLight(); break;
2150  }
2151  return true;
2152  }
2153  return false;
2154 }

2156 // Demo helper function to select among loaded fonts.
2157 // Here we use the regular BeginCombo()/EndCombo() api which is more the more flexible one.
2158 void ImGui::ShowFontSelector(const char* label)
2159 {
2160  ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
2161  ImFont* font_current = ImGui::GetFont();
2162  if (ImGui::BeginCombo(label, font_current->GetDebugName()))
2163  {
2164  for (int n = 0; n < io.Fonts->Fonts.Size; n++)
2165  if (ImGui::Selectable(io.Fonts->Fonts[n]->GetDebugName(), io.Fonts->Fonts[n] == font_current))
2166  io.FontDefault = io.Fonts->Fonts[n];
2167  ImGui::EndCombo();
2168  }
2169  ImGui::SameLine();
2170  ShowHelpMarker(
2171  "- Load additional fonts with io.Fonts->AddFontFromFileTTF().\n"
2172  "- The font atlas is built when calling io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsXXXX() or io.Fonts->Build().\n"
2173  "- Read FAQ and documentation in misc/fonts/ for more details.\n"
2174  "- If you need to add/remove fonts at runtime (e.g. for DPI change), do it before calling NewFrame().");
2175 }

2177 void ImGui::ShowStyleEditor(ImGuiStyle* ref)
2178 {
2179  // You can pass in a reference ImGuiStyle structure to compare to, revert to and save to (else it compares to an internally stored reference)
2180  ImGuiStyle& style = ImGui::GetStyle();
2181  static ImGuiStyle ref_saved_style;
2182 
2183  // Default to using internal storage as reference
2184  static bool init = true;
2185  if (init && ref == NULL)
2186  ref_saved_style = style;
2187  init = false;
2188  if (ref == NULL)
2189  ref = &ref_saved_style;
2190 
2191  ImGui::PushItemWidth(ImGui::GetWindowWidth() * 0.50f);
2192 
2193  if (ImGui::ShowStyleSelector("Colors##Selector"))
2194  ref_saved_style = style;
2195  ImGui::ShowFontSelector("Fonts##Selector");
2196 
2197  // Simplified Settings
2198  if (ImGui::SliderFloat("FrameRounding", &style.FrameRounding, 0.0f, 12.0f, "%.0f"))
2199  style.GrabRounding = style.FrameRounding; // Make GrabRounding always the same value as FrameRounding
2200  { bool window_border = (style.WindowBorderSize > 0.0f); if (ImGui::Checkbox("WindowBorder", &window_border)) style.WindowBorderSize = window_border ? 1.0f : 0.0f; }
2201  ImGui::SameLine();
2202  { bool frame_border = (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f); if (ImGui::Checkbox("FrameBorder", &frame_border)) style.FrameBorderSize = frame_border ? 1.0f : 0.0f; }
2203  ImGui::SameLine();
2204  { bool popup_border = (style.PopupBorderSize > 0.0f); if (ImGui::Checkbox("PopupBorder", &popup_border)) style.PopupBorderSize = popup_border ? 1.0f : 0.0f; }
2205 
2206  // Save/Revert button
2207  if (ImGui::Button("Save Ref"))
2208  *ref = ref_saved_style = style;
2209  ImGui::SameLine();

2346  if (ImGui::TreeNode("Glyphs", "Glyphs (%d)", font->Glyphs.Size))
2347  {
2348  // Display all glyphs of the fonts in separate pages of 256 characters
2349  for (int base = 0; base < 0x10000; base += 256)
2350  {
2351  int count = 0;
2352  for (int n = 0; n < 256; n++)
2353  count += font->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)(base + n)) ? 1 : 0;
2354  if (count > 0 && ImGui::TreeNode((void*)(intptr_t)base, "U+%04X..U+%04X (%d %s)", base, base+255, count, count > 1 ? "glyphs" : "glyph"))

2362  ImVec2 cell_p1(base_pos.x + (n % 16) * (cell_size + cell_spacing), base_pos.y + (n / 16) * (cell_size + cell_spacing));
2363  ImVec2 cell_p2(cell_p1.x + cell_size, cell_p1.y + cell_size);
2364  const ImFontGlyph* glyph = font->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)(base+n));
2365  draw_list->AddRect(cell_p1, cell_p2, glyph ? IM_COL32(255,255,255,100) : IM_COL32(255,255,255,50));
2366  if (glyph)
2367  font->RenderChar(draw_list, cell_size, cell_p1, ImGui::GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), (ImWchar)(base+n)); // We use ImFont::RenderChar as a shortcut because we don't have UTF-8 conversion functions available to generate a string.
2368  if (glyph && ImGui::IsMouseHoveringRect(cell_p1, cell_p2))
2369  {
2370  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
2371  ImGui::Text("Codepoint: U+%04X", base+n);
2372  ImGui::Separator();
2373  ImGui::Text("AdvanceX: %.1f", glyph->AdvanceX);
2374  ImGui::Text("Pos: (%.2f,%.2f)->(%.2f,%.2f)", glyph->X0, glyph->Y0, glyph->X1, glyph->Y1);
2375  ImGui::Text("UV: (%.3f,%.3f)->(%.3f,%.3f)", glyph->U0, glyph->V0, glyph->U1, glyph->V1);
2376  ImGui::EndTooltip();
2377  }
2378  }
2379  ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2((cell_size + cell_spacing) * 16, (cell_size + cell_spacing) * 16));
2380  ImGui::TreePop();
2381  }
2382  }
2383  ImGui::TreePop();
2384  }
2385  ImGui::TreePop();
2386  }
2387  ImGui::PopID();
2388  }
2389  static float window_scale = 1.0f;
2390  ImGui::DragFloat("this window scale", &window_scale, 0.005f, 0.3f, 2.0f, "%.1f"); // scale only this window
2391  ImGui::DragFloat("global scale", &ImGui::GetIO().FontGlobalScale, 0.005f, 0.3f, 2.0f, "%.1f"); // scale everything
2392  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2393  ImGui::SetWindowFontScale(window_scale);
2394  ImGui::TreePop();
2395  }

2506 // Demonstrate creating a window with custom resize constraints.
2507 static void ShowExampleAppConstrainedResize(bool* p_open)
2508 {
2509  struct CustomConstraints // Helper functions to demonstrate programmatic constraints
2510  {
2511  static void Square(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data) { data->DesiredSize = ImVec2(IM_MAX(data->DesiredSize.x, data->DesiredSize.y), IM_MAX(data->DesiredSize.x, data->DesiredSize.y)); }
2512  static void Step(ImGuiSizeCallbackData* data) { float step = (float)(int)(intptr_t)data->UserData; data->DesiredSize = ImVec2((int)(data->DesiredSize.x / step + 0.5f) * step, (int)(data->DesiredSize.y / step + 0.5f) * step); }
2513  };
2514 
2515  static bool auto_resize = false;
2516  static int type = 0;
2517  static int display_lines = 10;
2518  if (type == 0) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(-1, FLT_MAX)); // Vertical only
2519  if (type == 1) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, -1)); // Horizontal only
2520  if (type == 2) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(100, 100), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX)); // Width > 100, Height > 100
2521  if (type == 3) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(400, -1), ImVec2(500, -1)); // Width 400-500
2522  if (type == 4) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(-1, 400), ImVec2(-1, 500)); // Height 400-500
2523  if (type == 5) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Square); // Always Square
2524  if (type == 6) ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX), CustomConstraints::Step, (void*)100);// Fixed Step
2525 
2526  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = auto_resize ? ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize : 0;
2527  if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Constrained Resize", p_open, flags))
2528  {
2529  const char* desc[] =
2530  {
2531  "Resize vertical only",
2532  "Resize horizontal only",
2533  "Width > 100, Height > 100",
2534  "Width 400-500",
2535  "Height 400-500",
2536  "Custom: Always Square",
2537  "Custom: Fixed Steps (100)",
2538  };
2539  if (ImGui::Button("200x200")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(200, 200)); } ImGui::SameLine();
2540  if (ImGui::Button("500x500")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(500, 500)); } ImGui::SameLine();
2541  if (ImGui::Button("800x200")) { ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImVec2(800, 200)); }
2542  ImGui::PushItemWidth(200);
2543  ImGui::Combo("Constraint", &type, desc, IM_ARRAYSIZE(desc));
2544  ImGui::DragInt("Lines", &display_lines, 0.2f, 1, 100);
2545  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
2546  ImGui::Checkbox("Auto-resize", &auto_resize);
2547  for (int i = 0; i < display_lines; i++)
2548  ImGui::Text("%*sHello, sailor! Making this line long enough for the example.", i * 4, "");
2549  }
2550  ImGui::End();
2551 }

2553 // Demonstrate creating a simple static window with no decoration + a context-menu to choose which corner of the screen to use.
2554 static void ShowExampleAppSimpleOverlay(bool* p_open)
2555 {
2556  const float DISTANCE = 10.0f;
2557  static int corner = 0;
2558  ImVec2 window_pos = ImVec2((corner & 1) ? ImGui::GetIO().DisplaySize.x - DISTANCE : DISTANCE, (corner & 2) ? ImGui::GetIO().DisplaySize.y - DISTANCE : DISTANCE);
2559  ImVec2 window_pos_pivot = ImVec2((corner & 1) ? 1.0f : 0.0f, (corner & 2) ? 1.0f : 0.0f);
2560  if (corner != -1)
2561  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(window_pos, ImGuiCond_Always, window_pos_pivot);
2562  ImGui::SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.3f); // Transparent background
2563  if (ImGui::Begin("Example: Simple Overlay", p_open, (corner != -1 ? ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove : 0) | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar|ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize|ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize|ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings|ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing|ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNav))
2564  {

2566  ImGui::Separator();
2567  if (ImGui::IsMousePosValid())
2568  ImGui::Text("Mouse Position: (%.1f,%.1f)", ImGui::GetIO().MousePos.x, ImGui::GetIO().MousePos.y);
2569  else
2570  ImGui::Text("Mouse Position: <invalid>");
2571  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow())
2572  {
2573  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Custom", NULL, corner == -1)) corner = -1;
2574  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Top-left", NULL, corner == 0)) corner = 0;
2575  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Top-right", NULL, corner == 1)) corner = 1;
2576  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Bottom-left", NULL, corner == 2)) corner = 2;
2577  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Bottom-right", NULL, corner == 3)) corner = 3;
2578  if (p_open && ImGui::MenuItem("Close")) *p_open = false;
2579  ImGui::EndPopup();
2580  }
2581  ImGui::End();
2582  }
2583 }

2585 // Demonstrate using "##" and "###" in identifiers to manipulate ID generation.
2586 // This apply to regular items as well. Read FAQ section "How can I have multiple widgets with the same label? Can I have widget without a label? (Yes). A primer on the purpose of labels/IDs." for details.
2587 static void ShowExampleAppWindowTitles(bool*)
2588 {
2589  // By default, Windows are uniquely identified by their title.
2590  // You can use the "##" and "###" markers to manipulate the display/ID.
2591 
2592  // Using "##" to display same title but have unique identifier.
2593  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(100,100), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
2594  ImGui::Begin("Same title as another window##1");
2595  ImGui::Text("This is window 1.\nMy title is the same as window 2, but my identifier is unique.");
2596  ImGui::End();
2597 
2598  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(100,200), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
2599  ImGui::Begin("Same title as another window##2");
2600  ImGui::Text("This is window 2.\nMy title is the same as window 1, but my identifier is unique.");
2601  ImGui::End();
2602 
2603  // Using "###" to display a changing title but keep a static identifier "AnimatedTitle"
2604  char buf[128];
2605  sprintf(buf, "Animated title %c %d###AnimatedTitle", "|/-\\"[(int)(ImGui::GetTime()/0.25f)&3], ImGui::GetFrameCount());
2606  ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(ImVec2(100,300), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
2607  ImGui::Begin(buf);
2608  ImGui::Text("This window has a changing title.");
2609  ImGui::End();

2612 // Demonstrate using the low-level ImDrawList to draw custom shapes.
2613 static void ShowExampleAppCustomRendering(bool* p_open)
2614 {
2615  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(350,560), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
2616  if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Custom rendering", p_open))
2617  {
2618  ImGui::End();
2619  return;
2620  }
2621 
2622  // Tip: If you do a lot of custom rendering, you probably want to use your own geometrical types and benefit of overloaded operators, etc.
2623  // Define IM_VEC2_CLASS_EXTRA in imconfig.h to create implicit conversions between your types and ImVec2/ImVec4.
2624  // ImGui defines overloaded operators but they are internal to imgui.cpp and not exposed outside (to avoid messing with your types)
2625  // In this example we are not using the maths operators!
2626  ImDrawList* draw_list = ImGui::GetWindowDrawList();
2627 
2628  // Primitives
2629  ImGui::Text("Primitives");
2630  static float sz = 36.0f;
2631  static float thickness = 4.0f;
2632  static ImVec4 col = ImVec4(1.0f,1.0f,0.4f,1.0f);
2633  ImGui::DragFloat("Size", &sz, 0.2f, 2.0f, 72.0f, "%.0f");
2634  ImGui::DragFloat("Thickness", &thickness, 0.05f, 1.0f, 8.0f, "%.02f");
2635  ImGui::ColorEdit3("Color", &col.x);
2636  {
2637  const ImVec2 p = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos();
2638  const ImU32 col32 = ImColor(col);
2639  float x = p.x + 4.0f, y = p.y + 4.0f, spacing = 8.0f;
2640  for (int n = 0; n < 2; n++)
2641  {
2642  float curr_thickness = (n == 0) ? 1.0f : thickness;
2643  draw_list->AddCircle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f, y+sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col32, 20, curr_thickness); x += sz+spacing;
2644  draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), col32, 0.0f, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, curr_thickness); x += sz+spacing;
2645  draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), col32, 10.0f, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, curr_thickness); x += sz+spacing;
2646  draw_list->AddRect(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), col32, 10.0f, ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft|ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight, curr_thickness); x += sz+spacing;
2647  draw_list->AddTriangle(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f, y), ImVec2(x+sz,y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x,y+sz-0.5f), col32, curr_thickness); x += sz+spacing;
2648  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y ), col32, curr_thickness); x += sz+spacing; // Horizontal line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)
2649  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x, y+sz), col32, curr_thickness); x += spacing; // Vertical line (note: drawing a filled rectangle will be faster!)
2650  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), col32, curr_thickness); x += sz+spacing; // Diagonal line
2651  draw_list->AddBezierCurve(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz*1.3f,y+sz*0.3f), ImVec2(x+sz-sz*1.3f,y+sz-sz*0.3f), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), col32, curr_thickness);
2652  x = p.x + 4;
2653  y += sz+spacing;
2654  }
2655  draw_list->AddCircleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f, y+sz*0.5f), sz*0.5f, col32, 32); x += sz+spacing;
2656  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), col32); x += sz+spacing;
2657  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), col32, 10.0f); x += sz+spacing;
2658  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), col32, 10.0f, ImDrawCornerFlags_TopLeft|ImDrawCornerFlags_BotRight); x += sz+spacing;
2659  draw_list->AddTriangleFilled(ImVec2(x+sz*0.5f, y), ImVec2(x+sz,y+sz-0.5f), ImVec2(x,y+sz-0.5f), col32); x += sz+spacing;
2660  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+thickness), col32); x += sz+spacing; // Horizontal line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)
2661  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+thickness, y+sz), col32); x += spacing+spacing; // Vertical line (faster than AddLine, but only handle integer thickness)
2662  draw_list->AddRectFilled(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+1, y+1), col32); x += sz; // Pixel (faster than AddLine)
2663  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(ImVec2(x, y), ImVec2(x+sz, y+sz), IM_COL32(0,0,0,255), IM_COL32(255,0,0,255), IM_COL32(255,255,0,255), IM_COL32(0,255,0,255));
2664  ImGui::Dummy(ImVec2((sz+spacing)*8, (sz+spacing)*3));
2665  }
2666  ImGui::Separator();
2667  {
2668  static ImVector<ImVec2> points;
2669  static bool adding_line = false;
2670  ImGui::Text("Canvas example");
2671  if (ImGui::Button("Clear")) points.clear();
2672  if (points.Size >= 2) { ImGui::SameLine(); if (ImGui::Button("Undo")) { points.pop_back(); points.pop_back(); } }
2673  ImGui::Text("Left-click and drag to add lines,\nRight-click to undo");
2674 
2675  // Here we are using InvisibleButton() as a convenience to 1) advance the cursor and 2) allows us to use IsItemHovered()
2676  // But you can also draw directly and poll mouse/keyboard by yourself. You can manipulate the cursor using GetCursorPos() and SetCursorPos().
2677  // If you only use the ImDrawList API, you can notify the owner window of its extends by using SetCursorPos(max).
2678  ImVec2 canvas_pos = ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos(); // ImDrawList API uses screen coordinates!
2679  ImVec2 canvas_size = ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail(); // Resize canvas to what's available
2680  if (canvas_size.x < 50.0f) canvas_size.x = 50.0f;
2681  if (canvas_size.y < 50.0f) canvas_size.y = 50.0f;
2682  draw_list->AddRectFilledMultiColor(canvas_pos, ImVec2(canvas_pos.x + canvas_size.x, canvas_pos.y + canvas_size.y), IM_COL32(50,50,50,255), IM_COL32(50,50,60,255), IM_COL32(60,60,70,255), IM_COL32(50,50,60,255));
2683  draw_list->AddRect(canvas_pos, ImVec2(canvas_pos.x + canvas_size.x, canvas_pos.y + canvas_size.y), IM_COL32(255,255,255,255));
2684 
2685  bool adding_preview = false;
2686  ImGui::InvisibleButton("canvas", canvas_size);
2687  ImVec2 mouse_pos_in_canvas = ImVec2(ImGui::GetIO().MousePos.x - canvas_pos.x, ImGui::GetIO().MousePos.y - canvas_pos.y);
2688  if (adding_line)
2689  {
2690  adding_preview = true;
2691  points.push_back(mouse_pos_in_canvas);
2692  if (!ImGui::IsMouseDown(0))
2693  adding_line = adding_preview = false;
2694  }
2695  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
2696  {
2697  if (!adding_line && ImGui::IsMouseClicked(0))
2698  {
2699  points.push_back(mouse_pos_in_canvas);
2700  adding_line = true;
2701  }
2702  if (ImGui::IsMouseClicked(1) && !points.empty())
2703  {
2704  adding_line = adding_preview = false;
2705  points.pop_back();
2706  points.pop_back();
2707  }
2708  }
2709  draw_list->PushClipRect(canvas_pos, ImVec2(canvas_pos.x+canvas_size.x, canvas_pos.y+canvas_size.y), true); // clip lines within the canvas (if we resize it, etc.)
2710  for (int i = 0; i < points.Size - 1; i += 2)
2711  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(canvas_pos.x + points[i].x, canvas_pos.y + points[i].y), ImVec2(canvas_pos.x + points[i+1].x, canvas_pos.y + points[i+1].y), IM_COL32(255,255,0,255), 2.0f);
2712  draw_list->PopClipRect();
2713  if (adding_preview)
2714  points.pop_back();
2715  }
2716  ImGui::End();
2717 }

2719 // Demonstrating creating a simple console window, with scrolling, filtering, completion and history.
2720 // For the console example, here we are using a more C++ like approach of declaring a class to hold the data and the functions.
2721 struct ExampleAppConsole
2722 {
2723  char InputBuf[256];
2724  ImVector<char*> Items;
2725  bool ScrollToBottom;
2726  ImVector<char*> History;
2727  int HistoryPos; // -1: new line, 0..History.Size-1 browsing history.
2728  ImVector<const char*> Commands;
2729 
2730  ExampleAppConsole()
2731  {
2732  ClearLog();
2733  memset(InputBuf, 0, sizeof(InputBuf));
2734  HistoryPos = -1;
2735  Commands.push_back("HELP");
2736  Commands.push_back("HISTORY");
2737  Commands.push_back("CLEAR");
2738  Commands.push_back("CLASSIFY"); // "classify" is here to provide an example of "C"+[tab] completing to "CL" and displaying matches.
2739  AddLog("Welcome to Dear ImGui!");
2740  }
2741  ~ExampleAppConsole()
2742  {
2743  ClearLog();
2744  for (int i = 0; i < History.Size; i++)
2745  free(History[i]);
2746  }
2747 
2748  // Portable helpers
2749  static int Stricmp(const char* str1, const char* str2) { int d; while ((d = toupper(*str2) - toupper(*str1)) == 0 && *str1) { str1++; str2++; } return d; }
2750  static int Strnicmp(const char* str1, const char* str2, int n) { int d = 0; while (n > 0 && (d = toupper(*str2) - toupper(*str1)) == 0 && *str1) { str1++; str2++; n--; } return d; }
2751  static char* Strdup(const char *str) { size_t len = strlen(str) + 1; void* buff = malloc(len); return (char*)memcpy(buff, (const void*)str, len); }
2752  static void Strtrim(char* str) { char* str_end = str + strlen(str); while (str_end > str && str_end[-1] == ' ') str_end--; *str_end = 0; }
2753 
2754  void ClearLog()
2755  {
2756  for (int i = 0; i < Items.Size; i++)
2757  free(Items[i]);
2758  Items.clear();
2759  ScrollToBottom = true;
2760  }
2761 
2762  void AddLog(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2)
2763  {
2764  // FIXME-OPT
2765  char buf[1024];
2766  va_list args;
2767  va_start(args, fmt);
2768  vsnprintf(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), fmt, args);
2769  buf[IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf)-1] = 0;
2770  va_end(args);
2771  Items.push_back(Strdup(buf));
2772  ScrollToBottom = true;
2773  }
2774 
2775  void Draw(const char* title, bool* p_open)
2776  {
2777  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(520,600), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
2778  if (!ImGui::Begin(title, p_open))
2779  {
2780  ImGui::End();
2781  return;
2782  }
2783 
2784  // As a specific feature guaranteed by the library, after calling Begin() the last Item represent the title bar. So e.g. IsItemHovered() will return true when hovering the title bar.
2785  // Here we create a context menu only available from the title bar.
2786  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem())
2787  {
2788  if (ImGui::MenuItem("Close"))
2789  *p_open = false;
2790  ImGui::EndPopup();
2791  }
2792 
2793  ImGui::TextWrapped("This example implements a console with basic coloring, completion and history. A more elaborate implementation may want to store entries along with extra data such as timestamp, emitter, etc.");
2794  ImGui::TextWrapped("Enter 'HELP' for help, press TAB to use text completion.");
2795 
2796  // TODO: display items starting from the bottom
2797 
2798  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Add Dummy Text")) { AddLog("%d some text", Items.Size); AddLog("some more text"); AddLog("display very important message here!"); } ImGui::SameLine();
2799  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Add Dummy Error")) { AddLog("[error] something went wrong"); } ImGui::SameLine();
2800  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Clear")) { ClearLog(); } ImGui::SameLine();
2801  bool copy_to_clipboard = ImGui::SmallButton("Copy"); ImGui::SameLine();
2802  if (ImGui::SmallButton("Scroll to bottom")) ScrollToBottom = true;
2803  //static float t = 0.0f; if (ImGui::GetTime() - t > 0.02f) { t = ImGui::GetTime(); AddLog("Spam %f", t); }
2804 
2805  ImGui::Separator();
2806 
2807  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(0,0));
2808  static ImGuiTextFilter filter;
2809  filter.Draw("Filter (\"incl,-excl\") (\"error\")", 180);
2810  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
2811  ImGui::Separator();
2812 
2813  const float footer_height_to_reserve = ImGui::GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y + ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing(); // 1 separator, 1 input text
2814  ImGui::BeginChild("ScrollingRegion", ImVec2(0, -footer_height_to_reserve), false, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar); // Leave room for 1 separator + 1 InputText
2815  if (ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow())
2816  {
2817  if (ImGui::Selectable("Clear")) ClearLog();
2818  ImGui::EndPopup();
2819  }
2820 
2821  // Display every line as a separate entry so we can change their color or add custom widgets. If you only want raw text you can use ImGui::TextUnformatted(log.begin(), log.end());
2822  // NB- if you have thousands of entries this approach may be too inefficient and may require user-side clipping to only process visible items.
2823  // You can seek and display only the lines that are visible using the ImGuiListClipper helper, if your elements are evenly spaced and you have cheap random access to the elements.
2824  // To use the clipper we could replace the 'for (int i = 0; i < Items.Size; i++)' loop with:
2825  // ImGuiListClipper clipper(Items.Size);
2826  // while (clipper.Step())
2827  // for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
2828  // However, note that you can not use this code as is if a filter is active because it breaks the 'cheap random-access' property. We would need random-access on the post-filtered list.
2829  // A typical application wanting coarse clipping and filtering may want to pre-compute an array of indices that passed the filtering test, recomputing this array when user changes the filter,
2830  // and appending newly elements as they are inserted. This is left as a task to the user until we can manage to improve this example code!
2831  // If your items are of variable size you may want to implement code similar to what ImGuiListClipper does. Or split your data into fixed height items to allow random-seeking into your list.
2832  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(4,1)); // Tighten spacing
2833  if (copy_to_clipboard)
2834  ImGui::LogToClipboard();
2835  ImVec4 col_default_text = ImGui::GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol_Text);
2836  for (int i = 0; i < Items.Size; i++)
2837  {
2838  const char* item = Items[i];
2839  if (!filter.PassFilter(item))
2840  continue;
2841  ImVec4 col = col_default_text;
2842  if (strstr(item, "[error]")) col = ImColor(1.0f,0.4f,0.4f,1.0f);
2843  else if (strncmp(item, "# ", 2) == 0) col = ImColor(1.0f,0.78f,0.58f,1.0f);
2844  ImGui::PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, col);
2845  ImGui::TextUnformatted(item);
2846  ImGui::PopStyleColor();
2847  }
2848  if (copy_to_clipboard)
2849  ImGui::LogFinish();
2850  if (ScrollToBottom)
2851  ImGui::SetScrollHere(1.0f);
2852  ScrollToBottom = false;
2853  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
2854  ImGui::EndChild();
2855  ImGui::Separator();
2856 
2857  // Command-line
2858  bool reclaim_focus = false;
2859  if (ImGui::InputText("Input", InputBuf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(InputBuf), ImGuiInputTextFlags_EnterReturnsTrue|ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion|ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory, &TextEditCallbackStub, (void*)this))
2860  {
2861  Strtrim(InputBuf);
2862  if (InputBuf[0])
2863  ExecCommand(InputBuf);
2864  strcpy(InputBuf, "");
2865  reclaim_focus = true;
2866  }
2867 
2868  // Demonstrate keeping focus on the input box
2869  ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus();
2870  if (reclaim_focus)
2871  ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(-1); // Auto focus previous widget
2872 
2873  ImGui::End();
2874  }
2875 
2876  void ExecCommand(const char* command_line)
2877  {
2878  AddLog("# %s\n", command_line);
2879 
2880  // Insert into history. First find match and delete it so it can be pushed to the back. This isn't trying to be smart or optimal.
2881  HistoryPos = -1;
2882  for (int i = History.Size-1; i >= 0; i--)
2883  if (Stricmp(History[i], command_line) == 0)
2884  {
2885  free(History[i]);
2886  History.erase(History.begin() + i);
2887  break;
2888  }
2889  History.push_back(Strdup(command_line));
2890 
2891  // Process command
2892  if (Stricmp(command_line, "CLEAR") == 0)
2893  {
2894  ClearLog();
2895  }
2896  else if (Stricmp(command_line, "HELP") == 0)
2897  {
2898  AddLog("Commands:");
2899  for (int i = 0; i < Commands.Size; i++)
2900  AddLog("- %s", Commands[i]);
2901  }
2902  else if (Stricmp(command_line, "HISTORY") == 0)
2903  {
2904  int first = History.Size - 10;
2905  for (int i = first > 0 ? first : 0; i < History.Size; i++)
2906  AddLog("%3d: %s\n", i, History[i]);
2907  }
2908  else
2909  {
2910  AddLog("Unknown command: '%s'\n", command_line);
2911  }
2912  }
2913 
2914  static int TextEditCallbackStub(ImGuiTextEditCallbackData* data) // In C++11 you are better off using lambdas for this sort of forwarding callbacks
2915  {
2916  ExampleAppConsole* console = (ExampleAppConsole*)data->UserData;
2917  return console->TextEditCallback(data);
2918  }
2919 
2920  int TextEditCallback(ImGuiTextEditCallbackData* data)
2921  {
2922  //AddLog("cursor: %d, selection: %d-%d", data->CursorPos, data->SelectionStart, data->SelectionEnd);
2923  switch (data->EventFlag)
2924  {
2925  case ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackCompletion:
2926  {
2927  // Example of TEXT COMPLETION
2928 
2929  // Locate beginning of current word
2930  const char* word_end = data->Buf + data->CursorPos;
2931  const char* word_start = word_end;
2932  while (word_start > data->Buf)
2933  {
2934  const char c = word_start[-1];
2935  if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == ',' || c == ';')
2936  break;
2937  word_start--;
2938  }
2939 
2940  // Build a list of candidates
2941  ImVector<const char*> candidates;
2942  for (int i = 0; i < Commands.Size; i++)
2943  if (Strnicmp(Commands[i], word_start, (int)(word_end-word_start)) == 0)
2944  candidates.push_back(Commands[i]);
2945 
2946  if (candidates.Size == 0)
2947  {
2948  // No match
2949  AddLog("No match for \"%.*s\"!\n", (int)(word_end-word_start), word_start);
2950  }
2951  else if (candidates.Size == 1)
2952  {
2953  // Single match. Delete the beginning of the word and replace it entirely so we've got nice casing
2954  data->DeleteChars((int)(word_start-data->Buf), (int)(word_end-word_start));
2955  data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, candidates[0]);
2956  data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, " ");
2957  }
2958  else
2959  {
2960  // Multiple matches. Complete as much as we can, so inputing "C" will complete to "CL" and display "CLEAR" and "CLASSIFY"
2961  int match_len = (int)(word_end - word_start);
2962  for (;;)
2963  {
2964  int c = 0;
2965  bool all_candidates_matches = true;
2966  for (int i = 0; i < candidates.Size && all_candidates_matches; i++)
2967  if (i == 0)
2968  c = toupper(candidates[i][match_len]);
2969  else if (c == 0 || c != toupper(candidates[i][match_len]))
2970  all_candidates_matches = false;
2971  if (!all_candidates_matches)
2972  break;
2973  match_len++;
2974  }
2975 
2976  if (match_len > 0)
2977  {
2978  data->DeleteChars((int)(word_start - data->Buf), (int)(word_end-word_start));
2979  data->InsertChars(data->CursorPos, candidates[0], candidates[0] + match_len);
2980  }
2981 
2982  // List matches
2983  AddLog("Possible matches:\n");
2984  for (int i = 0; i < candidates.Size; i++)
2985  AddLog("- %s\n", candidates[i]);
2986  }
2987 
2988  break;
2989  }
2990  case ImGuiInputTextFlags_CallbackHistory:
2991  {
2992  // Example of HISTORY
2993  const int prev_history_pos = HistoryPos;
2994  if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_UpArrow)
2995  {
2996  if (HistoryPos == -1)
2997  HistoryPos = History.Size - 1;
2998  else if (HistoryPos > 0)
2999  HistoryPos--;
3000  }
3001  else if (data->EventKey == ImGuiKey_DownArrow)
3002  {
3003  if (HistoryPos != -1)
3004  if (++HistoryPos >= History.Size)
3005  HistoryPos = -1;
3006  }
3007 
3008  // A better implementation would preserve the data on the current input line along with cursor position.
3009  if (prev_history_pos != HistoryPos)
3010  {
3011  data->CursorPos = data->SelectionStart = data->SelectionEnd = data->BufTextLen = (int)snprintf(data->Buf, (size_t)data->BufSize, "%s", (HistoryPos >= 0) ? History[HistoryPos] : "");
3012  data->BufDirty = true;
3013  }
3014  }
3015  }
3016  return 0;
3017  }
3018 };
3019 
3020 static void ShowExampleAppConsole(bool* p_open)
3021 {
3022  static ExampleAppConsole console;
3023  console.Draw("Example: Console", p_open);
3024 }

3026 // Usage:
3027 // static ExampleAppLog my_log;
3028 // my_log.AddLog("Hello %d world\n", 123);
3029 // my_log.Draw("title");
3030 struct ExampleAppLog
3031 {
3032  ImGuiTextBuffer Buf;
3033  ImGuiTextFilter Filter;
3034  ImVector<int> LineOffsets; // Index to lines offset
3035  bool ScrollToBottom;
3036 
3037  void Clear() { Buf.clear(); LineOffsets.clear(); }
3038 
3039  void AddLog(const char* fmt, ...) IM_FMTARGS(2)
3040  {
3041  int old_size = Buf.size();
3042  va_list args;
3043  va_start(args, fmt);
3044  Buf.appendfv(fmt, args);
3045  va_end(args);
3046  for (int new_size = Buf.size(); old_size < new_size; old_size++)
3047  if (Buf[old_size] == '\n')
3048  LineOffsets.push_back(old_size);
3049  ScrollToBottom = true;
3050  }
3051 
3052  void Draw(const char* title, bool* p_open = NULL)
3053  {
3054  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(500,400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
3055  ImGui::Begin(title, p_open);
3056  if (ImGui::Button("Clear")) Clear();
3057  ImGui::SameLine();
3058  bool copy = ImGui::Button("Copy");
3059  ImGui::SameLine();
3060  Filter.Draw("Filter", -100.0f);
3061  ImGui::Separator();
3062  ImGui::BeginChild("scrolling", ImVec2(0,0), false, ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
3063  if (copy) ImGui::LogToClipboard();
3064 
3065  if (Filter.IsActive())
3066  {
3067  const char* buf_begin = Buf.begin();
3068  const char* line = buf_begin;
3069  for (int line_no = 0; line != NULL; line_no++)
3070  {
3071  const char* line_end = (line_no < LineOffsets.Size) ? buf_begin + LineOffsets[line_no] : NULL;
3072  if (Filter.PassFilter(line, line_end))
3073  ImGui::TextUnformatted(line, line_end);
3074  line = line_end && line_end[1] ? line_end + 1 : NULL;
3075  }
3076  }
3077  else
3078  {
3079  ImGui::TextUnformatted(Buf.begin());
3080  }
3081 
3082  if (ScrollToBottom)
3083  ImGui::SetScrollHere(1.0f);
3084  ScrollToBottom = false;
3085  ImGui::EndChild();
3086  ImGui::End();
3087  }

3152 // Demonstrate create a simple property editor.
3153 static void ShowExampleAppPropertyEditor(bool* p_open)
3154 {
3155  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(430,450), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
3156  if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Property editor", p_open))
3157  {
3158  ImGui::End();
3159  return;
3160  }
3161 
3162  ShowHelpMarker("This example shows how you may implement a property editor using two columns.\nAll objects/fields data are dummies here.\nRemember that in many simple cases, you can use ImGui::SameLine(xxx) to position\nyour cursor horizontally instead of using the Columns() API.");
3163 
3164  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_FramePadding, ImVec2(2,2));
3165  ImGui::Columns(2);
3166  ImGui::Separator();
3167 
3168  struct funcs
3169  {
3170  static void ShowDummyObject(const char* prefix, int uid)
3171  {
3172  ImGui::PushID(uid); // Use object uid as identifier. Most commonly you could also use the object pointer as a base ID.
3173  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding(); // Text and Tree nodes are less high than regular widgets, here we add vertical spacing to make the tree lines equal high.
3174  bool node_open = ImGui::TreeNode("Object", "%s_%u", prefix, uid);
3175  ImGui::NextColumn();
3176  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
3177  ImGui::Text("my sailor is rich");
3178  ImGui::NextColumn();
3179  if (node_open)
3180  {
3181  static float dummy_members[8] = { 0.0f,0.0f,1.0f,3.1416f,100.0f,999.0f };
3182  for (int i = 0; i < 8; i++)
3183  {
3184  ImGui::PushID(i); // Use field index as identifier.
3185  if (i < 2)
3186  {
3187  ShowDummyObject("Child", 424242);
3188  }
3189  else
3190  {
3191  ImGui::AlignTextToFramePadding();
3192  // Here we use a Selectable (instead of Text) to highlight on hover
3193  //ImGui::Text("Field_%d", i);
3194  char label[32];
3195  sprintf(label, "Field_%d", i);
3196  ImGui::Bullet();
3197  ImGui::Selectable(label);
3198  ImGui::NextColumn();
3199  ImGui::PushItemWidth(-1);
3200  if (i >= 5)
3201  ImGui::InputFloat("##value", &dummy_members[i], 1.0f);
3202  else
3203  ImGui::DragFloat("##value", &dummy_members[i], 0.01f);
3204  ImGui::PopItemWidth();
3205  ImGui::NextColumn();
3206  }
3207  ImGui::PopID();
3208  }
3209  ImGui::TreePop();
3210  }
3211  ImGui::PopID();
3212  }
3213  };
3214 
3215  // Iterate dummy objects with dummy members (all the same data)
3216  for (int obj_i = 0; obj_i < 3; obj_i++)
3217  funcs::ShowDummyObject("Object", obj_i);
3218 
3219  ImGui::Columns(1);
3220  ImGui::Separator();
3221  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
3222  ImGui::End();
3223 }

3225 // Demonstrate/test rendering huge amount of text, and the incidence of clipping.
3226 static void ShowExampleAppLongText(bool* p_open)
3227 {
3228  ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(520,600), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
3229  if (!ImGui::Begin("Example: Long text display", p_open))
3230  {
3231  ImGui::End();
3232  return;
3233  }
3234 
3235  static int test_type = 0;
3236  static ImGuiTextBuffer log;
3237  static int lines = 0;
3238  ImGui::Text("Printing unusually long amount of text.");
3239  ImGui::Combo("Test type", &test_type, "Single call to TextUnformatted()\0Multiple calls to Text(), clipped manually\0Multiple calls to Text(), not clipped (slow)\0");
3240  ImGui::Text("Buffer contents: %d lines, %d bytes", lines, log.size());
3241  if (ImGui::Button("Clear")) { log.clear(); lines = 0; }
3242  ImGui::SameLine();
3243  if (ImGui::Button("Add 1000 lines"))
3244  {
3245  for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
3246  log.appendf("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog\n", lines+i);
3247  lines += 1000;
3248  }
3249  ImGui::BeginChild("Log");
3250  switch (test_type)
3251  {
3252  case 0:
3253  // Single call to TextUnformatted() with a big buffer
3254  ImGui::TextUnformatted(log.begin(), log.end());
3255  break;
3256  case 1:
3257  {
3258  // Multiple calls to Text(), manually coarsely clipped - demonstrate how to use the ImGuiListClipper helper.
3259  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0,0));
3260  ImGuiListClipper clipper(lines);
3261  while (clipper.Step())
3262  for (int i = clipper.DisplayStart; i < clipper.DisplayEnd; i++)
3263  ImGui::Text("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", i);
3264  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
3265  break;
3266  }
3267  case 2:
3268  // Multiple calls to Text(), not clipped (slow)
3269  ImGui::PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ItemSpacing, ImVec2(0,0));
3270  for (int i = 0; i < lines; i++)
3271  ImGui::Text("%i The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog", i);
3272  ImGui::PopStyleVar();
3273  break;
3274  }
3275  ImGui::EndChild();
3276  ImGui::End();
3277 }
